page.title: 19NOTABLE EVENTS
page.content: {OPENING OF NEW HEALTH CENTRE. As Aviemore developed as a holiday centre,it became apparent that the medical facilities available were inadequate to cope with the growing population. The local practice has increased from 2400 to 3200 patients in the ten years to 1985. Doctors also have to deal with 450-600 skiing accidents per season.The old surgery with 2 consulting rooms and 1 treatment room between 4 doctors was too small.The new{health centre}has 60 rooms on two levels.It has 4 consulting rooms,2 interview rooms,2 treatment rooms,a plaster room,a gym plus facilities for X-rays and physio- therapy.These new facilities mean that the Aviemore practice can now deal with many cases that before had to be sent to Inverness.
